posts.name: Laurens Schunk
posts.cooked:
Hi,

Whenever I try to deploy my code, the task discoverroborio fails. This only occurs on my Mac (MacOS Sequoia 15.2), and works on everyone else’s computer. This is also a new issue and did not occur before I updated to 2025 WPILib. We are using a roborio 1, imaged to the latest version (v2.0). Below is the error I see:

Other info:

I can still ssh into the robot and ping it just fine.

The Roborio address is static.

Visual studio code has permission to access devices on the local network.

The team number has been set in WPILib

I have already tried:

reinstalling WPILib

restarting computer

restarting robot

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked: Can you deploy from other machines? I’ve seen similar behavior with a roborio out of date but that doesn’t seem like your issue. Did you format it with the 2025 image or just update the firmware?

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
Can you ssh from the VS Code terminal? What is the IP address of your computer?

Do you have multiple versions of VS Code installed?

posts.name: Laurens Schunk
posts.cooked: Other machines are able to deploy to the robot. I am also able to deploy from outside of VScode. It seems to be an issue with that. I am not sure what settings I need to adjust to make it work.

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked:
If you run

gradlew.bat deploy

from the vscode terminal, what happens?

posts.name: Herb Schilling
posts.cooked: Just wanted to let you know that we are having the same problem with another students Mac laptop. We tried a lot of different things but no luck!

posts.name: Herb Schilling
posts.cooked:
A fellow mentor found this and it fixed our problem!

visual-studio-code, raspberry-pi, vscode-remote, vscode-remote-ssh

asked by Adithya on 05:02PM - 29 Sep 24 UTC

Just do

Settings>Privacy & Security>Local Network and allow VS Code

link_counts.title: visual studio code - VSCode Remote SSH - failed: Error: No route to host - Stack Overflow

posts.name: Laurens Schunk
posts.cooked: Unfortunately, this did not work for me.

posts.name: Laurens Schunk
posts.cooked:
I have found a workaround: I open a terminal (outside of VS Code) and cd into the project. I can then run ./gradlew deploy and deploy the code to the robot.

I believe that the issue is that the VS Code app is not in the applications directory, but I cannot move it there because a lot of it’s function comes from it’s position relative to the rest of the wpilib directory.
